title: Infinite respawn loop: daemon uses wrong prefix for polecat health checks
description:
The daemon's checkPolecatHealth uses beads.PolecatBeadID() which hardcodes 'gt' prefix, but rigs use different prefixes (e.g., perch uses 'pe-'). This causes the daemon to look for agent beads in the wrong database.

Root cause:
- Daemon calls beads.PolecatBeadID(rigName, polecatName)  generates 'gt-perch-polecat-*'
- Perch's actual prefix is 'pe-', so agent beads are 'pe-perch-polecat-*'
- Daemon reads stale 'gt-*' beads from roles database instead of current 'pe-*' beads
- This can cause incorrect respawn decisions

Affected: perch polecats ace, valkyrie, keeper, cheedo, toast, warboy, morsov
Working: dag (respawned WITH work), slit, rictus, dementus, furiosa, nux, capable

Fix needed: daemon should query beads using the rig's actual prefix, not hardcoded 'gt'.
close_reason: Fixed in commit b0f3f31: daemon now uses GetPrefixForRig() to get the correct prefix for each rig instead of hardcoded 'gt'. Changes: daemon.go (checkPolecatHealth, ensureWitnessRunning, ensureRefineryRunning), lifecycle.go (identityToAgentBeadID, checkStaleAgents). Fix needs push to gastown repo.
